Metadata.title: Thyroid cancer
Metadata.description: A malignant thyroid tumor originating from follicular or C-cells of the thyroid gland and is the most common malignant neoplasm among other organs of the endocrine system.

Hero.title:
About cancer
Of the thyroid gland
Hero.description:
The <important>Butterfly Effect</important> project by <important>IBD.Team Group</important> is dedicated to
helping patients with thyroid disease live a full life. We believe
that these people can and should feel better and lead a
normal life without disease symptoms.

1.title:
Oncofighters - we'll get over
cancer once!

Test.title:
Is your
thyroid gland healthy?
Test.description:
In the early stages of cancer, a person may not feel any
symptoms. That is why it is so important to detect the
disease at an early stage.

questions.1: Do you have difficulty swallowing or a feeling of a "lump in the throat"?
questions.2: Have you noticed dry skin, brittle hair or hair loss lately?
questions.4: Do you have long-term (more than two days) bowel problems (constipation or diarrhea)?
questions.5: Have you been feeling tired lately, even after a good night's sleep?
questions.6: Did any of your close relatives have thyroid problems?
questions.7: Do you experience unreasonable emotional outbursts: increased irritability, tearfulness, etc.?
questions.8: Do you often experience tremors in your hands and body?
questions.9: Have you noticed any unexplained weight fluctuations in one direction or another lately?
questions.10: Have you noticed that you are looking worse? Do you notice puffiness of the face or swelling under the eyelids?
questions.11: Have you become inattentive and find it difficult to concentrate and focus on your work?
questions.12: Do you have difficulty memorizing information?
questions.15: Do you periodically feel pain in the heart area, although the cardiogram is normal?

normal.title: (Normal)
normal.description: Congratulations, there is nothing wrong with your thyroid gland!

medium.title: (Medium)
medium.description: You should consider visiting an endocrinologist and having your thyroid function checked. The sooner you check your thyroid condition, the sooner you will receive proper treatment and avoid serious health problems.

bad.title: (Bad)
bad.description: It is highly likely that you have abnormalities in the endocrine system. You should visit an endocrinologist and have your thyroid function checked. Most often, diagnostics begins with an ultrasound examination of the organ and a TSH level test.

critical.title: (Critical)
critical.description: An appointment with an endocrinologist cannot be postponed! You have signs of thyroid dysfunction.

Ultrasound.title:
Thyroid gland ultrasound.
What you want to know
Ultrasound.description:
Ultrasound helps to detect various problems, such as nodules,
cysts, or tumors in the thyroid gland. It can be useful for
monitoring already known conditions.

Biopsy.title:
Thyroid aspiration biopsy
of the thyroid gland
Biopsy.description:
This method is an important tool in the diagnosis of various
thyroid diseases, including hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism,
thyroid goiters, and thyroid cancer.

Oncoscreening.title:
Oncoscreening
for thyroid cancer
Oncoscreening.description:
Oncoscreening helps to detect various problems, such as
neoplasms, tumors, or abnormalities in the thyroid gland.
It can be useful for monitoring already known conditions.

Tells.title:
Stories of people
who have been screened
Tells.description:
I want to tell you about how a screening colonoscopy
saved my life. For two years, my doctor kept reminding me
that I needed to have a colonoscopy...

about.title: About us
about.description: IBD.Team initiated the Intercept Cancer and Oncofighters program to achieve success in the fight against cancer.
about.goal: Our mission is to provide everyone with the necessary tools to detect cancer early and reduce the risk of developing the disease so that you can live longer and better.
